alert.note: Alert for Allen; Clinton; Cumberland; Monroe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Clinton, southern Monroe, southern Allen and southeastern Cumberland Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 444 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Albany to 7 miles northwest of Westmoreland. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Monroe, southeastern Cumberland, southern Allen and southwestern Clinton Counties, including the following locations... Littrell, Fleet, Bugtussle, Blythe, Harlan Crossroads, Freetown, Gamaliel, Petroleum, Alonzo and Forest Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
